question: Which country's UNESCO World Heritage Site is "The Loire Valley between Sully-sur-Loire and Chalonnes"?
explanation: The central part of the Loire Valley, located in France, was added to the World Heritage Sites list of UNESCO. The Loire Valley has been called the "Garden of France" and is housed with over a thousand chateaux, each with distinct architectural embellishments of the early medieval to the late Renaissance periods. The Loire Valley is an outstanding cultural landscape of great beauty, containing historic towns and villages, great architectural monuments (the ch√¢teaux), and cultivated lands formed by many centuries of interaction between their population and the physical environment, primarily the river Loire itself.
